article.title: Simulating Linear Logic in 1-Only Linear Logic

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1: The Horn Implication\n\n**Question:** This figure illustrates the program construct used to represent what type of formula in Linear Logic?
Figure 2: The Stack Operations\n\n**Question:** What Linear Logic construct does this figure depict the program representation of?
Figure 3: Strong Forking\n\n**Question:** This program construct, depicted in the figure, is used to represent what type of formula?
Figure 4: The Axiom Case\n\n**Question:**  What does this figure demonstrate in the context of Linear Logic derivations?
choices: A contradiction derived from a misapplication of rules.
The application of the Cut rule.
A strong solution for a sequent with an empty right-hand side.
A trivial axiom situation where the simple product on both sides of the sequent is identical.
